page.title: 04CURRIE NEWSPAPER
page.content: Our local paper is the Currie and Balerno News. It covers the news in Currie, Balerno, Juniper Green and Baberton. It employs twelve workers, who work three times a month to produce twelve pages of articles plus four pages of advertising. No one in the paper works full time and nobody actually owns it, as it is a community paper. It now costs 15p to buy and is printed in black ink with coloured headings. The paper has been in existence for ten years now and gets most of its money from advertising, since it costs hundreds of pounds to produce. The paper has to be careful what it prints, incase people sue them. The paper is produced from home, although use is made of the Heriot-Watt University as well. The circulation figures for the paper exceed 2500 copies per month.
